revised_title: Edith Bulbring: A Pioneering Scientist in Smooth Muscle Physiology
tldr: Edith Bulbring was a distinguished pharmacologist and smooth muscle physiologist who made significant contributions to the field of smooth muscle research. She is remembered as the world's most influential scientist in this area. Her techniques led to increased knowledge of smooth muscle function and transmitter action. Born in Bonn, Germany, Bulbring studied medicine and worked in Germany and England before settling in Oxford, where she worked at the Department of Pharmacology until her retirement.
